column4: + the disk shows up in gparted, and i can format it to ext3 there.. but i can't mount it. nothing except gparted seems to recognise the hard drive.
Did you try to mount the partition in a 'terminal' window?
i've tried mounting it manually before, and it hasn't worked, but when i did it now it DID. however when remounting my fstab (sudo mount -a) it complains the line containing my 2nd hd is incorrect.
but... i can't see anything wrong with it
I would suggest that you mount it in a 'terminal' until you can consistantly 'mount' and 'umount' it.  Then you know what really works.
Thne go after the  /etc/fstab  content with some confidence.
hmm. yeah. well, "sudo mount /dev/hdb1 ~/hd1" works, however the line "/dev/hdb1 /home/christopher/hd1/ ext3 defaults 0 0" in fstab does not... i see no incosistency there.
Understood.  Could it be that fstab needs    TAB    between each entry?
i don't think so. does it?
Also:  I see that there is the entry         /home/christopher/hd1/          that does not need a       /       at the end.
Well   I use     TAB   between each entry.   Maybe they are not necessary.  But I agree.  I see nothing wrong with your entry.
hdb1   would be the slave connector of the primary IDE cable.  The first partition on that drive.  Is that the cable connection of the drive physically?
yeah that's the primary slave. and the partition is formatted as "primary" ext3 in gparted. it shows up in gparted, but nowhere else.
And I assume the diretcory  /home/christopher/hd1    actually exists.
